body_html: The problem is probably that with XLA, we currently perform execution past max(seq_len); and for dynamic_rnn, if your shape(inputs)[1] (time) changes between session.run calls, it'll re-JIT the graph. @jpienaar @prb12 does one of you want to "own" this issue? I'm making some changes to enable dynamic_rnn to use max(seq_len) as the loop bound but someone still needs to document that the input shape should not change too often, except by intelligent padded bucketing in the input pipeline.

I'm making some changes to enable dynamic_rnn to use max(seq_len) as the loop bound but someone still needs to document that the input shape should not change too often, except by intelligent padded bucketing in the input pipeline.
body: The problem is probably that with XLA, we currently perform execution past `max(seq_len)`; and for `dynamic_rnn`, if your `shape(inputs)[1]` (time) changes between session.run calls, it'll re-JIT the graph.  @jpienaar @prb12 does one of you want to "own" this issue?  I'm making some changes to enable `dynamic_rnn` to use `max(seq_len)` as the loop bound but someone still needs to document that the input shape should not change too often, except by intelligent padded bucketing in the input pipeline.
